title: Cloudburst triggers flood emergency on Babusar road; tourists evacuated
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 21 (APP): Three bodies were received at RHQ, (Regional Headquarter Hospital) Chilas with one injured person under treatment following the sudden flood emergency while tourists stranded at various points were evacuated to safety.
Video Playerhttps://www.app.com.pk/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/WhatsApp-Video-2025-07-21-at-23.42.24-3.mp400:0000:0000:00Use Up/Down Arrow keys to increase or decrease volume.National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) said in a statement that the incident occurred around 3:30 PM when a cloudburst struck the Babusar Road stretch between Jal and Diyung, affecting approximately 7 to 8 kilometers.Video Playerhttps://www.app.com.pk/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/WhatsApp-Video-2025-07-21-at-23.42.23.mp400:0000:0000:00Use Up/Down Arrow keys to increase or decrease volume.
The area sustained heavy damage, with 14 to 15 major blockages caused by landslides, debris, and flash floods.
Deputy Commissioner and Superintendent of Police Diamer visited the site and managed to reach the midpoint.
Video Playerhttps://www.app.com.pk/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/WhatsApp-Video-2025-07-21-at-23.42.24-1.mp400:0000:0000:00Use Up/Down Arrow keys to increase or decrease volume.
The remaining stretch was inaccessible due to boulder deposits. Transport arranged by Girls Degree College and Police was used to relocate stranded tourists to hotels in Chilas.
Video Playerhttps://www.app.com.pk/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/WhatsApp-Video-2025-07-21-at-23.42.23-2.mp400:0000:0000:00Use Up/Down Arrow keys to increase or decrease volume.
Babusar Road remains severely blocked, while the Karakoram Highway (KKH) is also closed at Lal Parhi and Tatha Pani. Between 10 to 15 vehicles are reportedly stuck in nallahs and slide-affected areas.
